Have a backup generator or portable power bank to charge your devices and run essential appliances. This can include items such as a refrigerator, refrigerator, and water filtration system.
Have a fire starting method, as matches, lighters, and lighter fluid can come in handy if you need to keep warm or cook food.
Know basic first aid skills to help yourself or others if you are injured. CPR and basic wound care can be lifesaving skills to learn.
Have a communication plan in place to contact friends, family, or authorities in case of emergencies or if you need help.
Stay informed about power outages and restoration schedules by following local news or emergency alerts, so you know when to expect power to be restored.
